```json
{
  "header": {
    "type": null,
    "numBeamsReq": null,
    "keywords": [],
    "majorVersion": null,
    "minorVersion": null,
    "dxaOut": null,
    "implInsert": null

usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: Script filename 'PC.mcr' lacks 'sd_' or 'Multipage' prefixes. Logic includes selectEntity with filterGenBeam(), Body creation, Milling/Drilling operations, and HardWrComp generation. These are strictly 3D modeling operations (GenBeam processing).

requiredSettings: PC.xml (Settings file containing Manufacturer data required for initialization)

insertionFlow.promptOriginal: |Select a point on the beam to position the connector|

opmProperties.description: |Defines the Distance Between the parts. -integer indicates nr of parts|
|Shows the calculated distance between the articles|
|Defines whether clip lock will be applied or not|
|Defines the Mill Width for the connector beam.|
|Defines the Mill Length for the connector beam.|
|Defines the Mill Depth for the connector beam.|

settingsFiles.purpose: Stores manufacturer data (Knapp Walco), product families, dimensions, and default tooling settings.

scriptPurpose.summary: Automatically generates and distributes Knapp Walco plate connectors (specifically Walco-V series) between a main beam and a perpendicular connector beam, including necessary machining and hardware lists.
scriptPurpose.typicalUseCase: Connecting a secondary beam (e.g., purlin or joist) perpendicular to a main beam using standardized plate connectors from Knapp Walco.

parameters.name: sManufacturer
parameters.businessMeaning: Selects the specific hardware manufacturer to load specifications from. Currently supports Knapp.
parameters.affectsOutput: Filters available families and products; determines catalog data used.

parameters.name: sFamily
parameters.businessMeaning: Selects the product family (e.g., Walco-V) to categorize the specific connector type.
parameters.affectsOutput: Filters available products; defines general geometry constraints.

parameters.name: sProduct
parameters.businessMeaning: Selects the exact part number/model of the plate connector, defining its physical dimensions and fastening requirements.
parameters.affectsOutput: Determines the size of the plate, milling dimensions, and drill patterns.

parameters.name: sModeDistribution
parameters.businessMeaning: Determines if connectors are spaced evenly along the beam or placed at fixed intervals.
parameters.affectsOutput: Calculates spacing logic: 'Even' maximizes spacing within bounds, 'Fixed' uses 'Max Distance' as exact step.

parameters.name: dDistanceBottom
parameters.businessMeaning: The clearance distance from the start of the beam (e.g., face of column) to the center of the first connector.
parameters.affectsOutput: Shifts the first connector along the beam's Y-axis.

parameters.name: dDistanceTop
parameters.businessMeaning: The clearance distance from the end of the beam (e.g., face of column) to the center of the last connector.
parameters.affectsOutput: Shifts the last connector along the beam's Y-axis.

parameters.name: dDistanceBetween
parameters.businessMeaning: In 'Even' mode: Maximum allowed spacing between connectors (centers). In 'Fixed' mode: Exact spacing. Negative value sets a fixed number of connectors.
parameters.affectsOutput: Calculates the number of connectors and their spacing positions.

parameters.name: dDistanceBetweenResult
parameters.businessMeaning: Read-only value showing the actual calculated distance between connector centers.
parameters.affectsOutput: Visual feedback only; displays final geometry distribution.

parameters.name: nNrResult
parameters.businessMeaning: Read-only value showing the total quantity of connectors inserted.

parameters.name: dOffset
parameters.businessMeaning: Lateral offset of the connector along the X-axis (width of beam) relative to the beam's centerline or selected face.
parameters.affectsOutput: Moves the connector and associated machining laterally across the beam face.

parameters.name: sClipLock
parameters.businessMeaning: Enables or disables the inclusion of a clip-lock (Sperrklappe) hardware component.
parameters.affectsOutput: Adds/removes Clip Lock item from hardware list.

parameters.name: dMillFemaleWidth
parameters.businessMeaning: Width of the pocket milled into the main (female) beam to receive the connector plate. 0 uses product default.
parameters.affectsOutput: Geometry of the rectangular milling on the main beam.

parameters.name: dMillFemaleLength
parameters.businessMeaning: Length of the pocket milled into the main (female) beam along the beam's axis. 0 uses product default.
parameters.affectsOutput: Geometry of the rectangular milling on the main beam.

parameters.name: dMillFemaleDepth
parameters.businessMeaning: Depth of the pocket milled into the main (female) beam. 0 uses product default.
parameters.affectsOutput: Geometry of the rectangular milling on the main beam.

parameters.name: dDrillFemaleDiameter
parameters.businessMeaning: Diameter of holes drilled in the main (female) beam for the connector fasteners. 0 uses product default.
parameters.affectsOutput: Size of drill points generated on the main beam.

parameterDependencies.effect: Resets sFamily and sProduct to defaults, reloading lists from new manufacturer's XML data.
Updates the available sProduct list based on the selected family.
Loads default dimensions (Width, Length, Depth, Diameter) from XML for the specific article.
Recalculates the count (nNrResult) and actual spacing (dDistanceBetweenResult) of connectors along the beam.

outputEntities.description: Plate connectors (Walco-V) and optionally Clip Locks added to the BOM.
Rectangular pocket to recess the plate connector into the beam.

workflowDiagram: Attempt to load settings from 'hsbTSL' MapObject (PC.xml)
Check if Settings/PC.xml exists in Company or Install path
Load Manufacturer list from XML into memory
Verify Manufacturer data exists (if empty, show error and erase instance)
Prompt user to select a GenBeam (getGenBeam)
Prompt user to select a point on the beam for connector position (getPoint)
Read Property defaults (Manufacturer, Family, Product, Distribution, Offset, Tooling)
Generate geometry based on selected Product and Distribution mode
Apply Milling and Drilling to the selected GenBeam
Generate HardWrComp (Hardware) items for BOM (Connectors and optional Clip Locks)
Assign hardware to GenBeam and complete insertion

path1.name: MapObject Found
steps: Read settings directly from hsbTSL dictionary
Proceed to entity selection

path2.name: MapObject Not Found
steps: Search for PC.xml in _kPathHsbCompany\TSL\Settings
If not found, search in _kPathHsbInstall\Content\General\TSL\Settings
If file found, create MapObject from XML
If file not found, script may lack default data

path1.name: Data Valid
steps: Populate Property lists (Family, Product)
Continue to Properties initialization

path2.name: Data Invalid/Empty
steps: Report error message: 'Could not find manufacturer data. Tool will be deleted.'
Execute eraseInstance()
Terminate script

path1.name: Even Mode
steps: Calculate available length between Start and End distances
Divide by Max Distance to determine quantity
Adjust spacing to be perfectly even
Update 'Real Distance between' and 'Nr.' properties

path2.name: Fixed Mode
steps: Use 'Max. Distance between' as exact step size
Place connectors starting from Start Distance
Stop if End Distance is violated
Update 'Real Distance between' and 'Nr.' properties

path3.name: Fixed Quantity (Negative dDistanceBetween)
steps: Interpret absolute value of 'Max. Distance' as exact number of parts
Calculate spacing to fit count within bounds
Update 'Real Distance between' and 'Nr.' properties

path1.name: Yes
steps: Read Clip Lock article data from XML
Add HardWrComp for Clip Lock to BOM
Multiply quantity by total connector count (nNrResult)

path2.name: No
steps: Skip Clip Lock HardWrComp generation

validationRules.errorMessage: <ScriptName>: Could not find manufacturer data. Tool will be deleted.
validationRules.recovery: Ensure PC.xml is present in the correct TSL Settings folder and contains valid Manufacturer entries.
Script terminates or repeats prompt based on standard hsbCAD behavior.
Script terminates or repeats prompt based on standard hsbCAD behavior.

validationRules.errorMessage: Notice reported if MapObject version differs from Installation XML version.
validationRules.recovery: User can review notice, but script proceeds with current loaded settings.

postInsertionActions.effect: Updates dimensions (Width/Length/Depth) and drill patterns from XML. Resets dependent properties to new defaults.
Recalculates positions of all connectors along the beam. Updates 'Nr.' and 'Real Distance' read-only properties.
Moves the connector machining laterally across the beam width.
Adds or removes the Clip Lock item from the beam's Hardware List.
Changes the size of the milled pocket or drilled holes (if not 0/default).

data.markdown:
# PC.mcr

## Overview
This script automates the generation and distribution of Knapp Walco plate connectors (specifically the Walco-V series) on a selected timber beam. It calculates the placement of connectors based on distribution rules, applies the necessary milling and drilling operations, and adds the hardware components to the Bill of Materials (BOM).

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | This is a 3D modeling script for GenBeams. |
| Paper Space | No | Not applicable for detailing views. |
| Shop Drawing | No | Does not generate 2D drawings directly. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**: At least one `GenBeam` must exist in the drawing.
- **Minimum Beam Count**: 1
- **Required Settings Files**:
    - `PC.xml`: This file must be located in either your Company folder (`...\TSL\Settings`) or the hsbCAD Install folder (`...\Content\General\TSL\Settings`). It contains the manufacturer data, product families, and default tooling dimensions.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` â†’ Select `PC.mcr` from the list.

### Step 2: Select Main Beam
```
Command Line: Select a GenBeam
Action: Click on the timber beam (e.g., a wall plate or rafter) where you want to install the connectors.
```

### Step 3: Position Connector
```
Command Line: Select a point on the beam to position the connector
Action: Click a point on the selected beam to define the start location or alignment area for the connectors.
```

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| **Component** | | | |
| Manufacturer | dropdown | --- | Select the hardware manufacturer (e.g., Knapp). This loads specific catalog data. |
| Family | dropdown | --- | Select the product family (e.g., Walco-V) based on the selected manufacturer. |
| Product | dropdown | --- | Select the specific part number/model. This determines the physical size and fastener pattern. |
| **Distribution** | | | |
| Mode of Distribution | dropdown | Even | Choose how connectors are spaced: **Even** (maximizes spacing) or **Fixed** (uses exact step size). |
| Start Distance | number | 0 | The distance from the start of the beam reference point to the center of the first connector. |
| End Distance | number | 0 | The distance from the end of the beam reference point to the center of the last connector. |
| Max. Distance between / Quantity | number | 500 | In **Even** mode: Maximum spacing allowed. In **Fixed** mode: Exact spacing. Enter a **negative number** to specify a fixed quantity of parts. |
| Real Distance between | number | 0 | *(Read-only)* Displays the calculated distance between connector centers. |
| Nr. | integer | 0 | *(Read-only)* Displays the total quantity of connectors calculated. |
| **Position** | | | |
| Offset | number | 0 | Lateral offset of the connector relative to the beam's reference axis/centerline. |
| **Tooling for connector beam** | | | |
| Clip Lock | dropdown | No | Select **Yes** to include a clip-lock (Sperrklappe) hardware item in the BOM. |
| **Milling for connector beam** | | | |
| Width | number | 0 | Width of the pocket milled into the beam. Set to **0** to use the product default from XML. |
| Length | number | 0 | Length of the pocket milled into the beam. Set to **0** to use the product default from XML. |
| Depth | number | 0 | Depth of the pocket milled into the beam. Set to **0** to use the product default from XML. |
| **Drilling for connector beam** | | | |
| Diameter | number | 0 | Diameter of the drill holes for fasteners. Set to **0** to use the product default from XML. |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| *None* | This script does not add custom items to the right-click context menu. All modifications are handled via the Properties Palette. |

## Settings Files
- **Filename**: `PC.xml`
- **Location**: Searches `_kPathHsbCompany\TSL\Settings` first, then `_kPathHsbInstall\Content\General\TSL\Settings`.
- **Purpose**: Stores the catalog of manufacturers, families, products, and their associated default dimensions (milling depth, drill diameters, etc.).

## Tips
- **Fixed Quantity**: To insert exactly 5 connectors along the beam, enter `-5` in the **Max. Distance between / Quantity** field. The script will automatically space them evenly within the Start/End boundaries.
- **Restoring Defaults**: If you manually change the milling dimensions (Width/Length/Depth) and want to revert to the manufacturer's standard size, simply change the value back to `0`.
- **Error Handling**: If the script immediately deletes itself after insertion, check the command line for an error message. This usually means `PC.xml` is missing or the manufacturer data within it is corrupt.

## FAQ
- **Q: Why did the tool disappear immediately after I selected the beam?**
    - A: The script could not find the required manufacturer data in `PC.xml`. Ensure the file exists in your TSL Settings folder and contains valid data.
- **Q: How do I change the connector size after inserting it?**
    - A: Select the inserted script instance in the drawing, open the **Properties** palette (Ctrl+1), and change the **Product** dropdown. The milling and drilling dimensions will update automatically if they are set to 0.
- **Q: Can I use this for hardware other than Knapp Walco?**
    - A: Only if the `PC.xml` file has been updated with data for other manufacturers. The script relies strictly on the data provided in that XML file.
